cohort: Multiple Myeloma, RRMM, by Treatment Site (2024–2025)
summary: Significant variation in Daratumumab regimen utilization across sites. Site A leads with 52% usage while Site D lags at only 21%, representing a $280,000 annual opportunity for optimization.

financial_impact.math: $280,000/year = 14.5% avg utilization gap × 2 sites × 26 patients × $73,000 margin difference

clinical_impact.description: Standardizing regimen selection across sites could improve patient outcomes.

metrics.description: Potential PFS improvement with optimized regimen selection

peer_comparison.description: Top-performing oncology networks maintain <10% variation in RRMM regimen selection across sites vs. your 34% range, representing significant opportunity for standardization.

financial_impact.math: $380,000/year = 24% standardization opportunity × 70 patients × $73,000 margin difference × site factor

suggestions.text: Investigate site-specific factors affecting regimen selection
Consider financial incentives for site directors
